actions.args: {"body": {"name": "Requesting Travel Stipend for [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok", "summary": "Hi there! We\\\\u{2019}re Team ValidAI, a group of five students from IIT Roorkee, India, and we\\\\u{2019}re excited about attending the upcoming [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. We recently built a decentralized AI project at ETHGlobal Singapore, and we\\\\u{2019}re now looking for some support to cover our flight costs to Bangkok. We will try to manage all other expenses like food ourselves.\\\\n", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "## Introduction\\\\nOur team created ValidAI, a decentralized AI marketplace, during ETHGlobal Singapore. The platform helps developers access pre-trained AI models for tasks like smart contract auditing, RAG agents and more while allowing AI/ML researchers to earn money when others use their models. We built this on NEAR Protocol, taking advantage of its low fees and secure environment.\\\\n\\\\n## Purpose\\\\nWe are passionate about improving ValidAI and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem. We feel there is a lot of scope of improvement and a lot of scope in the project to create real world value. The Bangkok hackathon is a great opportunity for us to take our project to the next level, learn more, and engage with the community. It will also help us reach the vision we have for this project.\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re just asking for help with our flights to Bangkok, which costs $350 per person. We would love to work at a NEAR Hackerhouse if there is such a provision. If not we would request upto $200 per person for accommodation. We\\\\u{2019}re not requesting any additional funds for food, or other expenses\\\\u{2014}we\\\\u{2019}ll handle those on our own.\\\\n\\\\n*Departure: Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand*\\\\n*Return: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Delhi, India*\\\\n\\\\n### Estimated breakdown:\\\\n\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 5 students\\\\nTotal request: $2750\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Project: ValidAI\\\\nValidAI is a decentralized AI marketplace that connects developers and researchers. Developers can use AI models for tasks like auditing smart contracts, while AI/ML researchers earn through a subscription-based model when their models are used. We\\\\u{2019}ve built it to be user-friendly, secure, and affordable, leveraging NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s technology.\\\\n\\\\n## Why We Need the Support\\\\nAs students, we\\\\u{2019}re covering as much as we can ourselves, but the flight cost is a bit of a challenge. This travel stipend would make it possible for us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on developing our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and continue building on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and help us cover the travel costs we need to participate. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\nTeam ValidAI", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "hashkat.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2750", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 129499620}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @hashkat.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Requesting Travel Stipend for [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHi there! We\\\\u{2019}re Team ValidAI, a group of five students from IIT Roorkee, India, and we\\\\u{2019}re excited about attending the upcoming [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. We recently built a decentralized AI project at ETHGlobal Singapore, and we\\\\u{2019}re now looking for some support to cover our flight costs to Bangkok. We will try to manage all other expenses like food ourselves.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=59)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 59, "snapshot": {"name": "Requesting Travel Stipend for [REDACTED] Movement - Bangkok", "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "summary": "Hi there! We\\\\u{2019}re Team ValidAI, a group of five students from IIT Roorkee, India, and we\\\\u{2019}re excited about attending the upcoming [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. We recently built a decentralized AI project at ETHGlobal Singapore, and we\\\\u{2019}re now looking for some support to cover our flight costs to Bangkok. We will try to manage all other expenses like food ourselves.\\\\n", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "hashkat.near", "timestamp": "1727994305519452557", "supervisor": null, "description": "## Introduction\\\\nOur team created ValidAI, a decentralized AI marketplace, during ETHGlobal Singapore. The platform helps developers access pre-trained AI models for tasks like smart contract auditing, RAG agents and more while allowing AI/ML researchers to earn money when others use their models. We built this on NEAR Protocol, taking advantage of its low fees and secure environment.\\\\n\\\\n## Purpose\\\\nWe are passionate about improving ValidAI and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem. We feel there is a lot of scope of improvement and a lot of scope in the project to create real world value. The Bangkok hackathon is a great opportunity for us to take our project to the next level, learn more, and engage with the community. It will also help us reach the vision we have for this project.\\\\n\\\\n## Request for Travel Stipend\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re just asking for help with our flights to Bangkok, which costs $350 per person. We would love to work at a NEAR Hackerhouse if there is such a provision. If not we would request upto $200 per person for accommodation. We\\\\u{2019}re not requesting any additional funds for food, or other expenses\\\\u{2014}we\\\\u{2019}ll handle those on our own.\\\\n\\\\n*Departure: Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand*\\\\n*Return: Bangkok, Thailand \\\\u{2192} Delhi, India*\\\\n\\\\n### Estimated breakdown:\\\\n\\\\nFlight cost per person: $350\\\\nAccommodation cost per person: $200\\\\nTeam size: 5 students\\\\nTotal request: $2750\\\\n\\\\n## About Our Project: ValidAI\\\\nValidAI is a decentralized AI marketplace that connects developers and researchers. Developers can use AI models for tasks like auditing smart contracts, while AI/ML researchers earn through a subscription-based model when their models are used. We\\\\u{2019}ve built it to be user-friendly, secure, and affordable, leveraging NEAR Protocol\\\\u{2019}s technology.\\\\n\\\\n## Why We Need the Support\\\\nAs students, we\\\\u{2019}re covering as much as we can ourselves, but the flight cost is a bit of a challenge. This travel stipend would make it possible for us to attend the hackathon and focus fully on developing our project and contributing to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n## Conclusion\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and continue building on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and help us cover the travel costs we need to participate. Thank you for considering our proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\nTeam ValidAI", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "hashkat.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2750", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "hashkat.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "Travel Stipends [REDACTED] hackathon - Bangkok, Nov. 24", "summary": "I am with Just One Giant Lab. We are building a collaboration and decision-making platform for science/research ecosystems. Our goal at the hackathon is to integrate NEAR wallet use the AI hub to build an agent helping researchers to summarize activities and reach their goal. ", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "**About JOGL and me**\\\\nI am [Louis Baudoin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/louis-baudoin-8288a23b/), the CPO of JOGL ([Just One Giant Lab](https://jogl.io/)). \\\\n\\\\nJOGL is both a collaboration platform for research ecosystems as well as a social network for builders to share their work, connect, and support each other. JOGL started as an experiment with a collective of scientists 7 years ago. Our first success was to prove at scale that when a community of experts can vote in a decentralized way to deliver microgrants, and support projects, the ROI is 10x what a centralized organization typically delivers. \\\\n\\\\nToday, we work with research institutes, schools, open source ecosystems, public agencies, and scientific consortiums. We focus on AI, quantum, and synthetic biology ecosystems.  JOGL has been bootstrapped from day 1. \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Our objectives for the hackathon**\\\\nFor this hackathon, our goal is to leverage the AI hub to build an agent that will solve the following problems:\\\\n\\\\n\\\\\\\"as a community member, if I take a break from the community, it is very hard for me to get back into it. I have 76 missed mentions\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\\\\"as a new community member, it is hard to figure out what\\\\\\'s the most impactful work I can do\\\\\\\" \\\\n\\\\\\\"as a community member, I would like to get updates on the platform about external resources such as models, datasets, repos etc ...\\\\\\\" \\\\n\\\\nThe agent will use JOGL-native functionalities: discussions, needs, events, papers, documents, resources. \\\\n\\\\n**Participating team**\\\\nOur CTO, and Heloisa who is just starting her PhD in ML. They will stay in London and Amsterdam respectively, and I will be on the ground to get practical feedback from the community. \\\\n\\\\nWe would welcome on the team anyone excited about our mission!\\\\n\\\\n**My travels**\\\\nI will be flying from and back to Lisbon. \\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "2a7f93bd2b420f0d6d026ef41987f60cde073aa9ed86f11fc53e7370db5f19b6", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1002", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 129531907}

We are building a collaboration and decision-making platform for science/research ecosystems. Our goal at the hackathon is to integrate NEAR wallet use the AI hub to build an agent helping researchers to summarize activities and reach their goal. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=60)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

I have 76 missed mentions\\\\\\\"\\\\n\\\\\\\"as a new community member, it is hard to figure out what\\\\\\'s the most impactful work I can do\\\\\\\" \\\\n\\\\\\\"as a community member, I would like to get updates on the platform about external resources such as models, datasets, repos etc ...\\\\\\\" \\\\n\\\\nThe agent will use JOGL-native functionalities: discussions, needs, events, papers, documents, resources. \\\\n\\\\n**Participating team**\\\\nOur CTO, and Heloisa who is just starting her PhD in ML. They will stay in London and Amsterdam respectively, and I will be on the ground to get practical feedback from the community. \\\\n\\\\nWe would welcome on the team anyone excited about our mission!\\\\n\\\\n**My travels**\\\\nI will be flying from and back to Lisbon. \\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "2a7f93bd2b420f0d6d026ef41987f60cde073aa9ed86f11fc53e7370db5f19b6", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1002", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "2a7f93bd2b420f0d6d026ef41987f60cde073aa9ed86f11fc53e7370db5f19b6", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "Stipend Proposal for Moraq Leagues at the Redacted Bangkok Hackathon", "summary": "Moraq Leagues a decentralized, multi-round prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "### Introduction\\\\nWe are team of 2 developers from India.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\t1. Harshal Bhangale, a full stack developer and a student from IIT Madras\\\\n\\\\t2. Sushmit Sarmah, a full-stack developer with over 12 years of experience..\\\\n\\\\n### Github profile and Personal website\\\\n[https://sushmitsarmah.github.io/](https://sushmitsarmah.github.io/)\\\\n[https://github.com/sushmitsarmah](https://github.com/sushmitsarmah)\\\\n[https://github.com/HarshalBhangale](https://github.com/HarshalBhangale)\\\\n\\\\n### Description\\\\nTogether, we are building **Moraq Leagues,** a decentralized, multi-round prediction game on the NEAR Protocol. This platform allows users to predict crypto or stock prices, stake tokens, and participate in progressively harder rounds, with the chance to win bigger rewards.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nWe plan to showcase our working MVP during the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok and further develop Moraq Leagues during the event. We\\\\\\'re on track to submit the online version of the project by October 25th and look forward to continuing work on it during the IRL hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Purpose\\\\nThe [REDACTED] hackathon is a fantastic opportunity for us to improve Moraq Leagues and contribute to the NEAR ecosystem. We believe this project has the potential to create real-world value in decentralized gaming and finance. Engaging with the NEAR community during the hackathon will help us learn, gain valuable feedback, and push our project to the next level.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Request for Travel Stipend \\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re requesting a travel stipend to help cover our flights and accommodation for the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n**Flight cost per person:** $350 (Delhi, India \\\\u{2192} Bangkok, Thailand, round trip)= **$700**\\\\n**Accommodation per person:** $200 / each = **$400**\\\\n**Team size:** 2 (Harshal and Sushmit)\\\\n**Total Request:** **$1,100**\\\\n\\\\nWe are only requesting assistance for flights and accommodation. We will manage other expenses such as food and local transport ourselves.\\\\n\\\\n### Project Overview:\\\\nMoraq Leagues is a prediction-based gaming platform that offers a fun and competitive environment for users to predict crypto or stock prices. Users participate in multiple rounds, and after each round, the bottom 50% are eliminated. Players can choose to cash out early or continue for bigger rewards. We are excited to build Moraq Leagues on the NEAR Protocol, leveraging its low transaction fees and scalability.\\\\nWe are very old near fans and experienced in Near tech stack.\\\\n\\\\n### Past Projects\\\\nAdjoining few of our hackathons link we participated in the past :\\\\n\\\\n  1. Photostock - Nearcon 2023 Lisbon Portugal Link : https://devpost.com/software/photostock\\\\n  2. Functionland Innovation Boost Zone - Near Metabuild 3 Link : https://devpost.com/software/functionland-innovation-boost-zone\\\\n  3. Wagerbox - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/wagerbox-0nej9\\\\n  4. Blitzsquad - ETHGlobal Showcase : .https://ethglobal.com/showcase/blitzsquad-2jt43\\\\n  5. PlayAstra - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/playastra-nsc3w\\\\n  6. Tribeviz - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/tribeviz-a3za7\\\\n  7. Superwallet - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/superwallet-wvqtj\\\\n  8. PassportGlobal - ETHGlobal Showcase : https://ethglobal.com/showcase/passportglobal-jptoi\\\\n  9. https://devfolio.co/projects/ercmeme-9760 \\\\n  10. https://devfolio.co/projects/whispercash-a588 \\\\n  11. https://devpost.com/software/dna-id https://devpost.com/software/chainlink-wrapper-for-fxblox-staking-v0-2-functions\\\\n  12. https://ethglobal.com/showcase/moraq-league-e14rc\\\\n  13. Aptos Winterschool Project: TribeBet : https://pitch.com/v/TribeBet-49ggp4/2923de38-72e3-436c-abcd-8339cab40cfe\\\\n\\\\nand many more exciting projects..\\\\n\\\\n#### Why We Need Support\\\\nAs students and developers, we are committed to covering as many costs as possible ourselves, but the cost of flights is a bit challenging. Your support would allow us to attend the hackathon and focus on building and improving our project without financial strain.\\\\n\\\\n### Conclusion\\\\nWe are eager to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok to showcase Moraq Leagues and continue developing on NEAR. Your support would mean a lot to us and enable us to bring our project to life.\\\\nThank you for considering our request.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "f58a611082e5f7d913749144019b7a4e355049a2be5d1574f107c65b26298a14", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1100", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses", "Hackathon"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 129562239}

{"id": 46, "body": {"name": "REDACTED NEAR Innovators Bootcamp Chandigarh(India) City Node #PoweredByHackbox", "summary": "We are looking to organize a boot camp that will be joined by dev-entrepreneurs, builders, and developers where they will learn how to build leveraging Near Blockchain and participate in the hackathon.  Our key focus area is to provide all the required support to teams competing at the global hackathon and help build impactful projects at scale. ", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "kyc_verified": true, "timeline_version": "V1", "sponsor_requested_review": true, "reviewer_completed_attestation": true}, "supervisor": "yarotska.near", "description": "# REDACTED Hackathon NEAR Innovators Bootcamp by BlockseBlock\\\\n\\\\nProposal Title: Redacted Hackathon NEAR Innovators Bootcamp by BlockseBlock | #PoweredByHackbox\\\\nRequested amount: $5K\\\\n\\\\n## **1. Hackathon Overview**\\\\n\\\\n**Title:** Redacted Hackathon NEAR Innovators Bootcamp by BlockseBlock \\\\n**Date & Format:** First week of October and in offline format\\\\n**Location:** Chandigarh, India\\\\n\\\\n## **2. Organizing Team**\\\\n**Organizers:** \\\\n[BlockseBlock](https://blockseblock.com/) is a global hackathon hosting platform with a strong developer community in SE Asia. We are already a global hackathon platform for ICP blockchain. With our unique approach of providing personalized support to developers, we are helping thousands of builders start their projects in the web3 and blockchain domains. Event Objectives**\\\\n**Goals:**\\\\n\\\\n**Onboard New Developers to the NEAR Ecosystem:**\\\\n\\\\nThe primary goal of the boot camp is to introduce and onboard new developers to the NEAR blockchain. By providing hands-on training and practical insights, the event will lower the barriers to entry for developers unfamiliar with NEAR, fostering a larger and more diverse developer community.\\\\n\\\\n**Educate Developers on NEAR Tools and Frameworks:**\\\\nThe boot camp aims to provide an in-depth understanding of NEAR\\\\u{2019}s development environment, including key tools like NEAR CLI, SDK, and smart contract languages (Rust/AssemblyScript). This will equip developers with the skills needed to build functional applications on NEAR.\\\\n\\\\n**Increase Participation in the NEAR Global Hackathon:**\\\\n\\\\nBy aligning the boot camp with NEAR\\\\\\'s global hackathon, we aim to act as a feeder program. The developers trained during the boot camp will be better prepared and more confident to participate in the hackathon, increasing overall participation.\\\\n\\\\n**Promote Innovation and Problem Solving:**\\\\n\\\\nThrough hands-on coding sessions and a dApp-building challenge, participants will be encouraged to think creatively and solve real-world problems using blockchain technology. This can inspire new, innovative projects that will further develop into full-scale applications during the hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n**Foster Collaboration and Networking:**\\\\n\\\\nThe boot camp will create opportunities for participants to connect with fellow developers, mentors, and industry experts. This will help foster collaboration and build teams for the global hackathon.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**Expected Outcomes:**\\\\n\\\\n**Increased Number of Quality Hackathon Participants:**\\\\n\\\\nWe expect a higher number of technically proficient and motivated developers to join the NEAR global hackathon, thanks to the skills and confidence they gain from this boot camp.\\\\n\\\\n**New NEAR-Based Projects and dApps:**\\\\n\\\\nParticipants will leave the boot camp with the skills to build applications on the NEAR blockchain. Some of these projects will be further developed and submitted during the global hackathon, contributing to NEAR\\\\u{2019}s ecosystem growth.\\\\n\\\\n**Strengthened NEAR Developer Community:**\\\\n\\\\nThe boot camp will create a sense of community among developers, building a network of talent that can continue collaborating beyond the event. This will contribute to the long-term growth of the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n**Improved Understanding of NEAR Development Tools:**\\\\n\\\\nDevelopers will leave with a solid understanding of NEAR\\\\\\'s development tools, enabling them to continue building on the platform even after the boot camp concludes.\\\\n\\\\n**High Engagement and Networking for Future Opportunities:**\\\\n\\\\nThe boot camp will foster relationships between developers, and mentors, potentially leading to long-term collaborations and involvement in future NEAR events and projects.\\\\nTarget Audience: Dev-Entrepreneurs, Builders and Developers who are looking to build impactful projects and applications leveraging the Near blockchain\\\\n\\\\n## **4. Challenges & Themes**\\\\n\\\\nDetails: The challenges and themes of the boot camp will be kept on similar lines of the theme of Redacted hackathon. \\\\n\\\\n## **5. Schedule and Activities**\\\\n\\\\n**Duration:** One-day boot camp of 8-10 hours\\\\n**Key Activities:** The planned activities for the developer boot camp will be as follows:\\\\n\\\\n**Introduction to NEAR Blockchain**\\\\n\\\\nOverview of NEAR Protocol and its ecosystem.\\\\nKey features of NEAR, such as scalability, security, and usability.\\\\n\\\\n**Setting Up Development Environment**\\\\n\\\\nStep-by-step guide to setting up tools (NEAR CLI, NEAR SDK, and wallet).\\\\nWalkthrough of key development resources and documentation.\\\\n\\\\n**Smart Contracts on NEAR**\\\\n\\\\nIntroduction to writing smart contracts using Rust/AssemblyScript.\\\\nBuilding a simple decentralized application (dApp).\\\\nDeploying and testing smart contracts on the NEAR testnet.\\\\n\\\\n**Interacting with NEAR Blockchain**\\\\n\\\\nUnderstanding NEAR accounts, transactions, and gas fees.\\\\nBuilding front-end applications that interact with NEAR smart contracts.\\\\nHandling wallet integrations for seamless user experience.\\\\n\\\\n**dApp Development Challenge**\\\\n\\\\nA hands-on session where participants work in teams to build a mini dApp.\\\\nLive coding support and troubleshooting by mentors.\\\\n\\\\n**Q&A and Networking**\\\\n\\\\nOpen Q&A session to clarify doubts and share insights.\\\\nNetworking opportunities with mentors and fellow developers.\\\\n\\\\n**Hackathon Prep & Best Practices**\\\\n\\\\nTips on participating in the global hackathon.\\\\nSharing best practices for creating successful NEAR-based applications.\\\\n\\\\n## **6.
